player
Class PlayerDataBase

java.lang.Object
  player.PlayerDataBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer, IPlayerDataBase
public class PlayerDataBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer, IPlayerDataBase

A class to store 2 Players and to appoint the current player allowed to play. The PlayerDataBase will observe his players. A Player notifies the database (by calling notifyObservers()) to indicate he wants to end his turn. At the same time, Squares will observe the PlayerDataBase, which will notify them at each player change, to calculate how long they should stay power failured.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

PlayerDataBase

public PlayerDataBase(Grid grid)
Creates a new empty PlayerDataBase. to fill the database with players, one has to call createNewDB. Until then the getCurrentPlayer() method will throw an exception.

Parameters:
grid - The grid we will play with.
Method Detail

createNewDB

public void createNewDB(
This method first clears the current database and then re-fills the
 database with PlayerDataBase.NUMBER_OF_PLAYERS newly created
 Player which it will observe.
 
 The order of the players is determined by the specified starting
 positions array. The first player allowed to play, is the player with the
 first starting position in the specified array.











Parameters:
playerStartingPositions - The specified starting coordinates for the players to create
grid - The grid on which the players will move

Throws:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments cannot be null. The lenght of the specified
         playerStartingCoordinates array must be
         2 and no two given coordinates can be
         the same.

                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException




Description copied from interface: IPlayerDataBase


Returns the player who is currently allowed to play.





Specified by:
getCurrentPlayer in interface IPlayerDataBase







Returns:
the IPlayer who is currently allowed to play.

Throws:

java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the database is empty.










update


public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)




This method is called whenever an observed object (i.e. a Player)
 notifies the database. A Player notifies the database to indicate he
 wants to end his turn. This happens if 
  • he has no actions left
    • 
 
  • he enters a Square with no power left and no active
 LightGrenade
    •  
  • if the user explicitly asks to end the
 player's turn.
    •  
    
 
 A PlayerDataBase stores PlayerDataBase.NUMBER_OF_PLAYERS
 Players and appoints the current player allowed to play. The
 PlayerDataBase will observe his players. A Player notifies the
 database to indicate he wants to end his turn.
 
 The database will only switch players if the player asking to end his
 turn is the current player ( this.getCurrentPlayer).

    

    

    Specified by:
    update in interface java.util.Observer
